abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Andhra Pradesh Community
            Forest Management Project for India were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: clear agreement between the Bank and the
            client on necessary policy changes can lead to a sound
            framework for project implementation. Required internal
            institutional reforms for Community Forest Management (CFM)
            require time and commitment by forest departments. In India,
            forest department field officers mainly carry out regulatory
            and enforcement duties with communities. Policy changes
            enacted by the Andhra Pradesh Forest Department (APFD) under
            the project delegated new responsibilities for financial and
            administrative powers from Forest Section Officer's
            (FSOs) to Forest Beat Officer's (FBOs). This meant an
            increased workload at the FBO level and a significant
            transformation in their approach to dealing with
            communities, which proved challenging for some staff.
            Strong, sustained and visionary leadership is required to
            support a shift from Joint Forest Management (JFM) to
            Community Forest Management (CFM). To fully empower Vana
            Samrakshana Samiti (VSS) groups to manage their forests
            requires sustained commitment by the forest department.
            Community groups will vary in terms of their own commitment
            and performance. Cooperation with Non-Governmental
            Organizations (NGOs) is essential when working with
            communities. The project worked closely with many NGOs,
            especially at the inception phase, to formulate government
            orders in respect of the CFM framework; for community
            mobilization, and for preparation of VSS microplans.
